As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences, but most Beatles fans consider the following albums to be the band's best works:

1. "Revolver" (1966): Widely regarded as one of the greatest albums ever made, "Revolver" marked a turning point in the Beatles' career. It features a wide variety of styles and sounds, from the psychedelic rock of "Tomorrow Never Knows" to the Indian-influenced "Love You To."

2. "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" (1967): Another landmark album, "Sgt. Pepper" was a concept album that explored a wide range of musical styles and themes. It features such classic songs as "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds," "With a Little Help from My Friends," and the title track.

3. "Abbey Road" (1969): The Beatles' final album, "Abbey Road" is widely regarded as a masterpiece. It includes such classics as "Come Together," "Something," and "Here Comes the Sun."

4. "Rubber Soul" (1965): "Rubber Soul" marked a significant departure for the band, as they moved away from straightforward rock and roll and began to experiment with new sounds and textures. The album includes such classics as "Norwegian Wood," "Drive My Car," and "In My Life."

5. "The White Album" (1968): The Beatles' eponymous double album is a sprawling and eclectic work that includes songs in a wide variety of styles, from the gentle balladry of "Julia" to the blistering rock of "Helter Skelter."

These albums are a great place to start, but really any Beatles album is worth listening to. They were truly one of the greatest musical acts in history and their music continues to inspire new generations of fans.
